metadata.title: ЭТИКА И ДУХОВНЫЕ ЦЕННОСТИ В ТРАДИЦИЯХ ВОСТОЧНЫХ ЦИВИЛИЗАЦИЙ
metadata.description: В статье рассматриваются основные этические принципы и духовные ценности, присущие традициям восточных цивилизаций. Анализируются философские и религиозные учения буддизма, конфуцианства, ислама и индуизма, а также их влияние на формирование нравственных норм. Особое внимание уделено современному значению восточной этики и её влиянию на глобальные процессы. Работа основана на анализе ключевых первоисточников и исследований в области религиоведения, философии и культурологии.

creators.name: Меликова Мартаба Нумоновна
creators.affiliation: Самаркандский государственный институт иностранных языков, Доктор философских наук (DSc), профессор, Заведующая кафедрой Гуманитарных наук и Информационных технологий

keywords: этика, духовные ценности, восточные цивилизации, буддизм, конфуцианство, ислам, нравственность, моральные нормы, религиозные традиции.
references: 1.	Конфуций. Лунь Юй – Изречения и беседы. Москва: Наука, 2010.
2.	Судзуки Д.Т. Основы дзэн-буддизма. Санкт-Петербург: Азбука-классика, 2013.
3.	Юнг К. Г. Психология и восточные религии. Москва: Академический проект, 2006.

journal.title: Multidisciplinary Journal of Science and Technology

metadata.title: DEVELOPMENT OF COGNITIVE ACTIVITY OF FUTURE TEACHERS IN THE CONTEXT OF INNOVATIVE EDUCATION AS AN URGENT PEDAGOGICAL PROBLEM
metadata.description: This article examines the issues of the development of cognitive activity of future teachers in the context of innovative education. Innovative approaches in the modern educational system, urgent problems in the process of training pedagogical personnel and their solutions have been analyzed. The article covers the theoretical and methodological foundations and practical significance of the development of cognitive activity of future teachers.

creators.name: Ulasheva Nafisa Ximmat qizi
creators.affiliation: Alfraganus unversiteti 1-kurs magistranti

keywords: innovative education, cognitive activity, future teachers, pedagogical competence, professional development, educational modernization.

metadata.title: NEW MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIES FOR EARLY DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT OF  HEPATORENAL SYNDROME
metadata.description: Hepatorenal syndrome is a very important medical condition that demonstrates a complex relationship between liver and kidney processes. This article reviews the importance of using new medical technologies and techniques in the management of hepatorenal syndrome. Modern medical innovations such as targeted therapy, regenerative medicine, and new biomarkers are important in improving the effectiveness of hepatorenal syndrome treatment. The study identifies opportunities to improve clinical outcomes through the implementation of new treatment procedures and methodologies. The article aims to provide high-quality medical care to patients through the implementation of modern diagnostic methods and personalized approaches. The introduction of new technologies can improve the quality of life and prolong the life of individuals with hepatorenal syndrome.

metadata.title: Boanerges: Makarios Education Journal, Vol.2 No.2 (2025)
metadata.description:
"Boanerges" (p ISSN 3025-3934, e ISSN 3025-3020) is an official school journal that emphasizes research, development, and innovation in the field of education. Its goal is to shape an outstanding generation through effective and up-to-date learning. Each edition of this journal features a variety of articles written by educators, students, researchers, and education practitioners. The article content covers related topics in Education, including Pedagogy, Science, Social Sciences, Humanities: Literature, Linguistics, and Anthropology, as well as efficient Sciences: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Physical Education, and other subjects in the field of education. "Boanerges" presents the latest research results, character-building, and provides valuable insights to readers to enhance the quality of learning in schools. The journal presents case studies and best practices from various fields of study, creating a positive and effective learning environment. Additionally, this journal provides a space for educators and students to share their experiences in facing challenges and achieving success in the education process. There are also book reviews on the latest literature relevant to the field of education. With an innovative spirit, "Boanerges" serves as a source of inspiration to seek new ways to advance the education system, promote collaboration, and enhance the abilities and creativity of students. Each issue of "Boanerges" becomes a valuable source of knowledge for educators, school leaders, researchers, and education practitioners in creating an inclusive, innovative, and high-quality results-oriented learning environment, with the hope of making a positive impact in shaping the next generation ready to face future challenges.

Journal title Boanerges
Subtitle Makarios Education Journal / Building an Excellent Generation Through Innovation in Learning
Initials BNS
Frequency 2 issues per year (February and August) 
e ISSN 3025-3020
p ISSN 3025-3934
Organizer Editorial Team [Makarios Educational Research Center]
Publisher Yayasan Pendidikan Gereja Masehi Advent Hari Ketujuh Makarios

metadata.title: EDUCATIONAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL LANDSCAPE OF GANGTOK : AN OVERVIEW OF NORTHERN DIVERSITY IN INDIA
metadata.description: This research aims to explore two critical aspects of Gangtok, the capital city of Sikkim, India: its educational landscape and environmental diversity, along with the sustainability efforts in the region. The study provides an in-depth examination of the educational systems, policies, infrastructure, and challenges faced by students and educators in Gangtok. Additionally, it explores the rich environmental diversity of the region, focusing on its unique biodiversity, ecological zones, and sustainability efforts to preserve the natural landscape. Through a mixed-methods approach combining surveys, interviews, field observations, and document analysis, the research investigates the key factors shaping education and environmental conservation in Gangtok. This research seeks to understand how these two critical domains interact with each other and contribute to the development of Gangtok while considering the broader context of northern India's diversity. Ultimately, the study offers insights into local sustainability initiatives and provides recommendations for improving education and enhancing environmental preservation efforts in the region.

data.title: Inteligencia artificial para la generación de contenidos en Iberoamérica: usos y proyecciones

metadata.title: Probabilistic Refinement Session Types (Artifact)
metadata.description:
PLDI 2025 Artifact Evaluation

Paper Abstract

Session types provide a formal type system to define and verify communication protocols between message-passing processes. In order to analyze randomized systems, recent works have extended session types with probabilistic type constructors. Unfortunately, all the proposed extensions only support constant probabilities which limits their applicability to real-world systems. Our work addresses this limitation by introducing probabilistic refinement session types which enable symbolic reasoning for concurrent probabilistic systems in a core calculus we call PReST. The type system is carefully designed to be a conservative extension of refinement session types and supports both probabilistic and regular choice type operators. We also implement PReST in a prototype which we use for validating probabilistic concurrent programs. The added expressive power leads to significant challenges, both in the meta theory and implementation of PReST, particularly with type checking: it requires reconstructing intermediate types for channels when type checking probabilistic branching expressions. The theory handles this by semantically quantifying refinement variables in probabilistic typing rules, a deviation from standard refinement type systems. The implementation relies on a bi-directional type checker that uses an SMT solver to reconstruct the intermediate types minimizing annotation overhead and increasing usability. To guarantee that probabilistic processes are almost-surely terminating, we integrate cost analysis into our type system to obtain expected upper bounds on recursion depth. We evaluate PReST on a wide variety of benchmarks from 4 categories: (i) randomized distributed protocols such as Itai and Rodeh's leader election, bounded retransmission, etc., (ii) parametric Markov chains such as random walks, (iii) probabilistic analysis of concurrent data structures such as queues, and (iv) distributions obtained by composing uniform distributions using operators like max, and sum. Our experiments show that the PReST type checker scales to large programs with sophisticated probabilistic distributions.

Artifact Evaluation

We would like to thank the reviewers for reviewing the artifact for the PLDI 2025 submission 431 titled "Probabilistic Refinement Session Types".

Instructions

Included Files

  • pldi25-paper431.pdf: Our submitted paper. 
  • README.md: Artifact evaluation instructions in Markdown format.
  • src.zip: OCaml source code for the PReST type checker.
  • examples.zip: PReST source code of benchmarks featured in paper.
  • editor.zip: VSCode and Emacs extensions for highlighting PReST code.
  • Dockerfile: Build recipe for PReST Docker images.
  • prest-docker-amd64.tar: Prebuilt PReST Docker image archive for AMD64.
  • prest-docker-arm64.tar: Prebuilt PReST Docker image archive for ARM64.
  • run_amd64.sh: Script for running PReST (AMD64) on all examples.
  • run_arm64.sh: Script for running PReST (ARM64) on all examples.

The following instructions assume that the contents of examples.zip have been extracted to a directory called examples.

Loading Docker Images

Our implementation of the PReST type checker is available as self-contained Docker images for AMD64 and ARM64 architectures. Usage of image on incompatible platforms may result in degradation of performance.

  • prest-docker-amd64.tar: Docker image archive for AMD64
  • prest-docker-arm64.tar: Docker image archive for ARM64 (works for Apple M-series cpus)

To load an image archive (e.g. `prest-docker-arm64.tar`) into Docker, run the following command:

docker load < prest-docker-arm64.tar

Running Individual Benchmarks

Once a platform appropriate image archive has been loaded into Docker, run PReST on an input file (e.g. examples/approx.st) using the following command:

docker run -i --rm prest-docker-arm64 --solver z3 < examples/approx.st

Notes:

  • -i: Docker flag for accepting STDIN.
  • --rm: Docker flag for removing container after execution.
  • --solver z3: PReST flag for using z3 as SMT solver backend. Use --solver cvc5 to run with cvc5 as backend.
  • < examples/approx.st: Pipe the contents of examples/approx.st to the PReST Docker container.
  • PReST is set to timeout after 20s if SMT backend has not finish solving.

Example Output:
➜ PReST-artifact git:(main) docker run -i --rm prest-docker-arm64 --solver z3 < examples/approx.st
SolverConnected: `z3`
TypeCheckSuccess
Diagnostics:
constraint size (Cons): 261
quantified vars (TVars): 21
probability vars (PVars): 12
solve time: 11.19ms

The output above states the following information:

  • SolverConnected: z3: PReST successfully connected to the z3 backend. Will show cvc5 if the option --solver cvc5 was used.
  • TypeCheckSuccess: Type checking `examples/approx.st` was successful. Will report `TypeCheckError` if checked program is not well-typed.
  • Diagnostics: Lists out various metrics regarding the constraints generated for `examples/approx.st`.

Running All Benchmarks

We provide 2 shell scripts run_amd64.sh and run_arm64.sh which will run the corresponding PReST Docker image on all *.st files in a directory. The following command runs PReST on all benchmarks included in the examples directory.

./run_arm64.sh ./examples  

The following table lists all benchmarks from Table 1 in the paper along with their corresponding filenames in the examples directory.

Program Filename z3(ms) cvc5(ms) TVars PVars Cons
unat gen unat_gen.st 15 31 8 4 145
unat pmf unat_pmf.st 20 timeout 14 8 219
unat cdf unat_cdf.st 22 timeout 14 8 219
umax cdf umax_cdf.st 2400 timeout 59 38 664
usum pmf usum_pmf.st 120 timeout 77 36 935
unat cmp unat_compare.st 36 timeout 26 18 244
debias coin_debias.st 9 timeout 18 12 194
onetimepad onetimepad.st 32 26 27 12 478
approx conj approx.st 11 31 21 12 261
random walk random_walk.st 10 13 6 4 85
bounded retransmit retransmission.st 35 36 12 0 796
leader election leader_elect.st 68 timeout 81 16 1749
dining philosopher random_dining.st 51 56 14 4 1359
consensus coin consensus_coin.st 75 64 37 4 1932
crowd forwarding crowd_forwarding.st 62 65 48 4 1662
zeroconf zeroconf.st 51 timeout 50 20 1064
unreliable queue unreliable_queue.st 19 188 21 12 607

Caveats

Constraint Metrics and Solver Performance

We have made minor modifications and refactoring for constraint generation. The constraint metrics and solver performance reported in the table above are slightly different from those reported in Table 1 of the paper. Most notably, umax cdf now only takes 2400ms to check instead of 6200ms. We will update Table 1 to reflect the latest performance metrics.

Concrete Syntax of PReST Implementation

There are some minor differences between the concrete syntax of our PReST implementation. These syntactic changes are made to allow PReST to be written using standard ASCII characters.

Name Abstract Syntax Concrete Syntax Change Description
internal choice ⊕{ ℓ : A } ?{ ℓ : A } `⊕` is written as `?`
external choice &{ ℓ : A } !{ ℓ : A } `&` is written as `!`
prob. internal choice ⊕P{ ℓᵖ : A } ?{ ℓ :p A } `⊕P` is written as `?`, prob. annotation `p` is written after colon instead of superscript
prob. external choice &P{ ℓᵖ : A } !{ ℓ :p A } `&P` is written as `!`, prob. annotation `p` is written after colon instead of superscript
lolli A ⊸ B !A.B binary connective `_ ⊸ _` corresponds to `!_ . _`
tensor A ⊗ B ?A.B binary connective `_ ⊗ _` corresponds to `?_ . _`
guard left ◃ʷ A <|{w} `◃` is written as `<|`, potential annotation `w` is written in braces instead of superscript
guard right ▹ʷ A |>{w} `▹` is written as `⎮>`, potential annotation `w` is written in braces instead of superscript
end protocol 1 end `1` is written as `end`
send label x.ℓ x.ℓ dot syntax `x.ℓ` is overloaded with sending deterministic label `x.ℓ`
send prob. label x..ℓ x.ℓ dot syntax `x.ℓ` is overloaded with sending probabilistic label `x..ℓ`
case case x (ℓ ⇒ P) match x {ℓ => P} match-expressions are overloaded with deterministic `case`
prob. case pcase x (ℓ ⇒ P) match x {ℓ => P} match-expressions are overloaded with probabilistic `pcase`
refinement assumption assume x P assume x proposition `P` can be omitted as it can be inferred during type checking
refinement assertion assert x P assert x proposition `P` can be omitted as it can be inferred during type checking

metadata.title: Estudo de caso powerless queen: campanha de conscientização sobre a questão da mulher na Índia
metadata.description: O presente estudo de caso visa analisar a campanha intitulada Powerless Queen, criada em 2018, a qual discute a conscientização sobre a questão da mulher na Índia. Uma pesquisa realizada pela instituição Fundação Thomson Reuters, com a participação de 550 especialistas nas questões das mulheres, questionou-se sobre quais seriam os cinco dos 193 países das Nações Unidas mais perigosos para as mulheres; a Índia foi eleito o pior e também em termos de assistência médica, recursos econômicos, práticas culturais ou tradicionais, violência e abuso sexual, violência não-sexual e tráfico humano. Nesse contexto, a ideia de conscientizar as pessoas do cenário desolador que vivem milhões de indianas cotidianamente, e buscar de alguma maneira, contribuições para a Nanhi Kali, ONG que se concentra na educação de meninas carentes desde 1996. A campanha foi lançada com um vídeo apresentando pela segunda melhor jogadora de xadrez da Índia, a Grande Mestre Tania Sachdev, que desafiava as pessoas a jogar no site e no app e tentar vencê-la no jogo com uma rainha impotente. A campanha “Powerless Queen” foi criada para a organização sem fins lucrativos Nanhi Kali, para divulgar o projeto que tem como principal objetivo educar meninas carentes na Índia. Nanhi Kali (que significa “pequeno botão”) foi criado em 1996, por Anand Mahindra, Presidente do grupo Mahindra.
